title: Bobby Lavin
text: Robert Edward Lavin (August 31, 1900 – November 1, 1972) was a <a href="college%20football">college football</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player for the <a href="Kentucky%20Wildcats">Kentucky Wildcats</a>. On the <a href="Kentucky%20Wildcats%20football">football</a> team, Lavin was a <a href="quarterback">quarterback</a> for coach <a href="William%20Juneau">Bill Juneau</a>'s Wildcats. In the 55–0 loss to <a href="1921%20Centre%20Praying%20Colonels%20football%20team">Centre</a> in 1921, Lavin was his team's lone star. The 1921 team scored on <a href="1921%20Vanderbilt%20Commodores%20football%20team">Vanderbilt</a> for the first time. He was a guard on the basketball team, playing with <a href="Basil%20Hayden">Basil Hayden</a>. The 1921 basketball team won a <a href="Southern%20Intercollegiate%20Athletic%20Association">Southern Intercollegiate Athletic Association</a> (SIAA) championship.
